src.Utility

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.Utility.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    This class helps to determine what entities need to be displayed on screen the screen by keeping track of the borders of the screen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Camera(Character c)
      Initialise a new camera object to fit the dimensions of the screen
      Camera(Character c, double wWidth, double wHeight)
      Initialise a new camera object that can determine which objects in the game should be drawn onto the screen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getScreenX(double x)
      Convert a world x-coordinate into a screen coordinate using the camera's current size and offset
      float getScreenY(double y)
      Convert a world y-coordinate into a screen coordinate using the camera's current size and offset
      double getWorldHeight()
      Get the height of the camera view
      double getWorldWidth()
      Get the width of the camera view
      double getWorldX()
      Get the x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the camera
      double getWorldY()
      Get the y-coordinate of the top-left corner of the camera
      boolean onScreen(int x, int y)
      Whether or not a given coordinate appears on the camera view
      void reallign(Character c)
      Reallign the camera view to center on the given character

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

              double wWidth,

        Initialise a new camera object that can determine which objects in the game should be drawn onto the screen

        wWidth - The world width of the camera view
        wHeight - The world height of the camera view
